programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: Tamara transforms a bedroom as she continues renovating a bungalow; knowing buyers expect a master suite, Tamara annexes a second room to enlarge the tiny closet and add a bathroom; Tamara and her father find the perfect tub, but it's painted black.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: After a contractor abandons an 1890s Craftsman-style home, Tamara Day steps in to finish its renovation; she repairs structural damage and tears down a load-bearing wall to enlarge the kitchen; an exterior iron staircase presents problems.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: Tamara enlarges the master bedroom in the Craftsman-style home and creates a study with a unique light fixture; she cannot salvage enough antique tiles for the bathroom floor but finds a way to reuse the old glass in the master bath.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: While renovating a French chateau, Tamara Day discovers that a recent renovation left the kitchen looking outdated and tacky; Tamara and her father go shopping for a Dutch door, then she restores plantation shutters.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: While working on a French chateau, Tamara overhauls a master suite covered in the tackiest wallpaper she's ever ripped out of a home; to preserve a backyard kitchenette and cobblestone pavers, Tamara will be forced to make budget-wrecking decisions.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: Tamara seeks to transform a multi-family 1892 brick Craftsman into a single-family dwelling while keeping its original details; she and her father attempt to recover a vintage pocket door trapped inside a wall and update the home's electricity.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: Tamara continues working on an 1892 Craftsman and struggles to add a master bathroom; then, she finds a way to reuse floor boards as a porch swing, but her plan to reuse a claw-foot bathtub hits a snag because of a narrow doorway.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: Tamara Day works on restoring a 1909 Craftsman home, opening up its meandering layout and ripping out the tacky additions that have stripped the house of its original charm; she saves vintage light switches and a wallpaper mural.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions

programme.title: Bargain Mansions

programme.title: Bargain Mansions

programme.title: Jade Fever
programme.desc: In Jade City, British Columbia, the Bunce family has for decades taken advantage of the region's rich jade deposits to mine for the precious stone in Northern B.C.'s Cassiar Mountains. This reality series follows the Bunce's operation, which employs most of the town's residents, and their efforts to turn various claims into elusive million-dollar jackpots. In addition to highlighting dangerous mining adventures, storylines include how "The Boss," Claudia Bunce, and her mine manager husband Robin secure investors and keep them happy, plus interplay between employees including Bunce brothers Joshua and Justin.

programme.desc: Scott and Cheyenne don't know it all, but these guys do! From military Special Forces, to the common weekend warrior, this crew trains you to be prepared for any situation, anywhere in the world.

programme.title: Trijicon's World of Sports Afield
programme.sub-title: Hunting Cape Buffalo In the Dande
programme.desc: Charlton Macallum Safaris' Buzz Charlton hunts Cape buffalo with Client Zach Neher in the beautiful Zambezi Valley of Zimbabwe.

programme.title: Hornady's Dark & Dangerous
programme.desc: Today's show is a triple dose of safari adventure and exciting big game species.

programme.title: Innerloc's Out-There
programme.desc: Corey and his mom head to New Hampshire for black bear with the Excalibur crossbow.

programme.title: North American Whitetail
programme.desc: Blake Garlock tries his luck during gun season at Ken Tenn Hunting with Larry and Tyler Porter. Dr. James Kroll discusses late season hunting strategies for rut-worn bucks. Haynes Shelton profiles the C.W. Shelton buck from Kentucky.

programme.title: The Maverick
programme.desc: Freddy and three dear friends join together for a week in Mule Deer Heaven with bows in hand.

programme.title: Into High Country
programme.desc: Jason heads to Oklahoma on a DIY hunt for whitetails in early November with two buck tags in his pack. Part 1.

programme.title: Wild Memories TV
programme.sub-title: One More for the Good Guys
programme.desc: Charlie Prickett heads to Nichol Farming and Outfitting in search of a scarred up warrior. Boomer finds success at Muddy Bottom Outfitters with Chris Bowden.

programme.title: Greg McHale's Wild Yukon
programme.sub-title: Ask Questions Later: A Bison Hunt
programme.desc: March is the prime season for hunting wild Yukon wood bison, and Greg loves to get after these incredible animals as the days get longer and winter begins to wind down. On this hunt, Greg finds what he's looking for: a lone bull.

programme.title: Guide's Tails
programme.desc: Ever wonder what full time guides buy when they tackle shop? Capt. Nate Chennaux and Capt. Ed Zyak spend some time at Howell Tackle talking about their favorite tackle picks.

programme.title: Dead Meat
programme.desc: What is a delicacy to some people can be a gross, super-slimy inedible creature to other. Prepare yourself for hagfish. Leysath and Ryan Newkirk cook them up with a side of jackrabbit tacos.

programme.title: Overland chronicles, the

programme.title: MOJO TV

programme.desc: It's freshwater fishing action in overdrive, with emphasis on top tactical maneuvers and precision lure presentation, as the In-Fisherman staff casts big baits for night-prowling walleyes.

programme.desc: The Riflemen team up with The Descendants of The North and harvest two Canadian bull elk.

programme.title: Becoming Orangutan
programme.desc: Welcome baby orangutan Topan, an orphan in need of a surrogate mom. Watch her learning journey in nursery school while her fellow students move through junior, senior, and wild-immersion schools. Meanwhile, 16-year-old Kasper preps for graduation.

programme.title: Supersenses
programme.desc: See the animals that push the limits of physics, chemistry and engineering to pull off feats that humans can only dream of, and find out how evolution granted them with such amazing abilities. Sometimes it takes a super-power just to survive.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Be an eyewitness to the death and resurrection that winter brings to Africa. Observe what comes with shorter days, from drought conditions to frigid winds, and marvel at the survival skills of animals and plants as they face the season's fury.

programme.title: The Great Elephant Tale
programme.desc: Follow the adventures of three elephants across three very distinct African habitats. Their travels combine to tell the story of how these emotional and intelligent creatures evolved over millions of years to survive on the continent.

programme.title: Becoming Orangutan
programme.desc: Welcome baby orangutan Topan, an orphan in need of a surrogate mom. Watch her learning journey in nursery school while her fellow students move through junior, senior, and wild-immersion schools. Meanwhile, 16-year-old Kasper preps for graduation.

programme.title: Supersenses
programme.desc: See the animals that push the limits of physics, chemistry and engineering to pull off feats that humans can only dream of, and find out how evolution granted them with such amazing abilities. Sometimes it takes a super-power just to survive.

programme.title: Zambia Untamed
programme.desc: As the dry season begins, thousands of animals are making their way to the Acacia Loop. Each must establish their place in the pecking order and avoid the dangerous residents who are all too willing to make a meal of the unwary.

programme.title: Zambia Untamed
programme.desc: Mvula is the youngest calf in the Madzi family. Temperatures are soaring. Lagoons and waterholes are drying up. This forces Mvula and his family to undertake a long and dangerous journey to the only remaining source of water: the Luangwa River.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Wild Wild East swims in the Rivers of Nova Scotia. Two species of fish, the Shad and the Gaspereau swim upstream to their ancestral spawning grounds, while a colony of Double-Crested Cormorants thrive on the mouth of the Pictou River.

programme.title: Into the Wild Colombia
programme.desc: The flat savannas of the Colombian Llanos are governed by seasonal extremes that push life to the brink. In this unforgiving arena, there are no second chances, and only creatures best adapted to their brutal extremes will make it through a year.

programme.title: Waterworld Africa
programme.desc: Living on the southwestern tip of Africa is an unusual colony of African penguins. Most African penguins prefer to breed on off-shore islands in the region, but human interference on their island homes has caused many birds to look elsewhere for suitable breeding sites.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Take to the sky to soar with the Bald Eagle. From Cape Breton's Bras d'Or Lake, to the bird's overwintering home in the Annapolis Valley, the Eagle's raise families, hunt and forage for food, and compete for territory with another bird of prey, the Osprey.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Be an eyewitness to the death and resurrection that winter brings to Africa. Observe what comes with shorter days, from drought conditions to frigid winds, and marvel at the survival skills of animals and plants as they face the season's fury.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Follow the ebb and flow of the tides. Over a hundred thousand sandpipers migrating from the Arctic to South America make a pit stop along the Bay of Fundy. On the other side of Nova Scotia, the rocky-coastline provides a home for harbor and grey seals.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: The Annapolis Valley is the Wild Wild East's most important agricultural center. We dive into the hive to explore the complex social structures of hardworking honeybees. The Monarch butterfly has traveled all the way from Mexico to feed off the local milkweed.

programme.title: Into the Wild Colombia
programme.desc: Mona, a female cotton top tamarin is all alone in her tropical forest home. She has left the security of her birth family to search for an unrelated troop which might provide her with a future mate.

programme.title: Waterworld Africa
programme.desc: Life in the savannas of Africa is ruled by water. And throughout the long dry season, life-giving rivers run dry and harsh drought conditions prevail, making waterholes crowded.

programme.title: Becoming Orangutan
programme.desc: Observe blossoming friendships and interspecies bonds in nursery school, and peek inside a bromance among junior-school buds Valentino, Yutris and Madara. See distractible Beni lean into his love of food and get a beating from a more-senior pupil.

programme.title: Supersenses
programme.desc: Dive into a dazzling world beyond human perception, where animals use their super senses to detect light we can't see, sound we can't hear and even stranger forces we can't begin to detect.

programme.title: Zambia Untamed
programme.desc: As the dry season begins, thousands of animals are making their way to the Acacia Loop. Each must establish their place in the pecking order and avoid the dangerous residents who are all too willing to make a meal of the unwary.

programme.title: Zambia Untamed
programme.desc: Mvula is the youngest calf in the Madzi family. Temperatures are soaring. Lagoons and waterholes are drying up. This forces Mvula and his family to undertake a long and dangerous journey to the only remaining source of water: the Luangwa River.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: It's a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the largest sand island on earth, and home to wild dingoes, six-foot sand-worms, and eucalyptus woodlands. Find out how everything lives happily together in a complex ecosystem built entirely upon sand.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: The beaches of California are some of the most beautiful in the world, but are they falling out of balance due to mankind's effects on nature? What does it take for the magnificent fauna of the Pacific Coast to keep living... on the "living beach"?

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Follow the ebb and flow of the tides. Over a hundred thousand sandpipers migrating from the Arctic to South America make a pit stop along the Bay of Fundy. On the other side of Nova Scotia, the rocky-coastline provides a home for harbor and grey seals.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: The Annapolis Valley is the Wild Wild East's most important agricultural center. We dive into the hive to explore the complex social structures of hardworking honeybees. The Monarch butterfly has traveled all the way from Mexico to feed off the local milkweed.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: It's Halifax through the eyes of its wildest residents. During the day, squirrels and chipmunks compete for territory in the city park. At night, Halifax's raccoons invade backyards and seagulls scour the streets for pizza.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Cape Breton Highlands National Park was established to protect the primeval forest from clear-cutting - but today the park faces a new threat. Moose, beavers and moths have combined to decimate large sections of the Boreal and Acadian woodlands.

programme.title: Into the Wild Colombia
programme.desc: This is the story of Julieta, a female golden dart frog, in search of her Romeo. She's about to lay her eggs and must find a male to fertilize them. Romeo's calls guide her through the forest, but crossing the dense rainforest is no easy feat.

programme.title: Waterworld Africa
programme.desc: Nestled on the western coast of South Africa lies an extraordinary cove that is host to an abundance of marine and bird life. It provides ample food and spurs a life cycle that reaches well beyond Africa. This is the Blue Lagoon.

programme.title: Becoming Orangutan
programme.desc: Experience a roller coaster of emotions and growing pains as the sanctuary's orangutans move through six grades toward their release into the wild. Discover how Dilla's fate suddenly changes, and watch as big boy Beni goes on an unwelcome diet.

programme.title: A Wild Year on Earth
programme.desc: In the early months of the year, the Earth's axial tilt brings the height of summer in some places and the depths of winter in others. See how life struggles to survive under these extreme conditions.

programme.title: The Big Dry
programme.desc: The rains are late. It is the most brutal time of year. Babies born into drought face starvation. Everything is desperate for rain. When it arrives, it is a downpour on an enormous scale. Alien creatures emerge into a different world. The wet season begins.

programme.title: Seasons of the Wild
programme.desc: In Southern Florida, a unique and complex ecosystem known as the Everglades has entered its winter season. Predator and prey are forced to live in close proximity due to a limited supply of water.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Wild Wild East's wetland habitats are at risk. These marshes and bogs are the ancient home of the endangered Blanding's Turtle. But each fall new turtles spring from the lake shores of Nova Scotia. If the vulnerable Blanding's can make it through their first few years of life, they'll live for almost a century. But saving the turtle means protecting the wetlands, and all the other amphibians and reptiles that call the slow-moving waters home.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: The relationships between species like lobsters, scallops and crabs are numerous and complicated. Changing water temperature is bringing invasive species to the Wild Wild East, putting pressure on the species humans count on for important commercial harvests.

programme.title: Animal Empires
programme.desc: Every empire needs a succession plan. Making babies - and raising them - is crucial for every species to survive. In some social circles, it takes a village to raise a family. In others, a single parent is all that stands between the vulnerability of youth and the threats of the wild.

programme.title: Waterworld Africa
programme.desc: Deep in southern Africa, a mighty river snakes through untamed wilderness. Its vast flood plains are a magnet for wildlife. In the dry season animals travel great distances to reach this oasis and during droughts space and resources are at a premium. But every animal has its place along the banks of the mighty Chobe river...
